info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 29 at 6:46PM PDT by NWS Reno
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Storey and southern Washoe Counties through 730 PM PDT... At 646 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Reno-Tahoe International Airport, or over Reno, moving north at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Reno, Sparks, Stead, Wingfield Springs, Northwest Reno, Spanish Springs, Lemmon Valley, Mogul, Golden Valley, Caughlin Ranch, Reno-Tahoe International Airport, Hidden Valley, Somersett, Verdi-Mogul, Lemmon Valley-Golden Valley, Cold Springs, Nws Reno and Sun Valley. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
